fields.description:
h3. Summary

When split issue via backlog, user will hit into the following error message:
{code}
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'state' of undefined
Resource: http://nasilemak.local:8782/jira782/s/c16deae1f57c260dbaeb33558417c08f-CDN/-dh5xrh/78002/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/22af66be4380b636cf6a44622ef3deba/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,atl.general,gh-rapid,jira.project.sidebar,com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.init,jira.global,jira.general,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&is-server-instance=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&nps-acknowledged=true&nps-not-opted-out=true&richediton=true
Line: 64752
Column: 22
{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce

*Scenario 1*
# Create two tickets and create a sprint
# Move one ticket into the sprint and then start the sprint.
# Resolve the ticket and complete the sprint.
# Reopen the ticket and it will reappear on the backlog.
# Attempt to split that issue

*Scenario 2* (Reproducible on 7.6.7 but not 7.6.0)
# Create a sprint
# Move two issues into that sprint
# Start sprint
# Switch back to 'backlog' view
# Move one issue from the sprint and back into backlog
# Attempt to split that issue

h3. Expected Results.

It should be allowing to split the ticket.

h3. Actual Results.

Failed to split issue and get a Javascript error message.

h3. Notes
 * Tested on Chrome
 * The problem is not happening in 7.7.0

h3. Workaround

Clone the issue out and don't check the 'clone sprint values'
fields.summary: Javascript error when split issue from backlog

fields.description:
h3. Description

Whenever you edit a sub-task directly through the Issue Detail View tab, the page seems to refresh, but this time the estimation will not be displayed anymore on the card. A refresh of the whole board page is required for the estimation to be displayed again.

h3. Steps to reproduce

* Create a board
* Create an issue
* Create a sub-task of said issue
* Configure estimation on the sub-task
* Access the board. Click on the issue and locate the box displaying sub-task issues. 
* You'll notice that the estimation is being displayed
!before.png|thumbnail!
* Edit the sub-task through the Issue Detail View. You'll notice that the estimation will be gone.
!aftr.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected results

The estimation will continue visible after the refresh.
fields.summary: Editing a sub-task causes the estimation to vanish until refresh in the issue detail view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The day remaining in sprint gadget currently Displays days Remaining as a Full day remaining, day of the sprint due date being 0 days remaining, But there is no indication as to what day that is and when the sprint goes one day over still shows 0 days remaining.

This is causing confusion on the actual date as discussed in the Community:
- https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Sprint-day-remaining-gadget-reports-incorrect-days/qaq-p/417148

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be use-full to indicate the days and hours remaining at a minimum for the the last day of the sprint and display the Scheduled sprint Completion date on the gadget to alleviate any confusion.

i.e. 23 hours remaining rather than 0 days remaining, OR 1 day and 23 hours remaining rather than 1 day remaining when the Sprint has 47 hours remaining, where 2 days remaining are displayed when 48+ hours till sprint completion.
 
h3. Workaround
Use an add-on such as the [Countdown Timer | https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211116/countdown-timer?hosting=server&tab=overview] add-on or the [Countdown Gadget | https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217224/countdown-gadget?hosting=server&tab=overview] add-on and manually create a countdown clock for the scheduled sprint start date.
fields.summary: Add Hours to day remaining in gadget

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Open a JIRA search issues window and enter a JIRA JQL query of project in ("project 1", "project 2") and fixVersion in (version1, version2)
 # Copy the URL from your browser window and paste as comment in Jira issue.
 # Observe closing parenthesis is not included in the link, but is necessary.

http://example.com/foo(0)bar(0)

*Expected Result:*

Closing parenthesis is not included in the link.

*Actual Result:*

Closing parenthesis would be included in the link.

*Workaround:*
 In order to bypass this behavior, you may simply end your URL with a "/", so that the closing parenthesis is not the last character of the URL:
*Ex.*
{code:java}
http://example.com/foo(0)bar(0)/{code}

Or you can encode the ending parenthesis using "%29" instead:
*Ex.*
{code:java}
http://example.com/foo(0)bar(0%29{code}
fields.summary: Copied JQL from URL, when input as comment the closing parenthesis is not made part of the link.

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Cleared "Remaining Estimates" are being re-added if a transition / edit is performed, and the transition / edit screen contains the remaining edit field.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure that the Time Tracking fields are associated with screens.
# Ensure that one of the workflow transitions has the clear "Remaining Estimates" post function.
# Create an issue.
# During issue creation, specify "Remaining Estimate" to 30 minutes.
# Move workflow transition through clear "Remaining Estimates" post function.
# Edit an issue, leave blank for "Remaining Estimates"

h2. Expected Results
* After step #5 above, the Remaining Estimates appears as "Not Set".
* After step #6 above, the Remaining Estimates continue to appear as "Not Set".

h2. Actual Results
* After step #5 above, the Remaining Estimates appears as "Not Set".
* After step #6 above, the Remaining Estimates appears as "30 minutes".
fields.summary: Cleared "Remaining Estimates" are being re-added if a transition or edit is performed, and the transition or edit screen contains the remaining edit field.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Permission helper incorrectly shows that user with JIRA Administrator permissions does not have “Manage Sprints” permission, while the user is definetely able to create / delete / start and complete sprints.

h3. Environment
JIRA Software, 7.0 → 7.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Deploy JIRA 7.9, create a software project, remove “Manage Sprint” permission from ALL users. Run Permission Helper and verify that the currently logged in user (with JIRA Administrator preivileges) does not have the “Manage Sprints” permission
# While logged in with that JIRA Administrator user (who’s supposedly does not have ‘manage sprints’ permission) create a sprint, start a sprint, stop a sprint – it all works contrary to the expectation that JIRA should not allow even JIRA Administrator to perform these operations.

h3. Expected Results

Permission helper should show that JIRA Administrator has the ‘manage sprints’ permission

h3. Actual Results
The permission helper shows that JIRA Administrator does not have the ‘manage sprints’ permission and yet the user is able to create/ manage / start and complete sprints

h3.Workaround
No workaround exists.
We raised a feature request to update the documentation:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-16124
fields.summary: Permission helper incorrectly shows JIRA Administrator 'manage sprints' permission

The AWS quickstart (cloudformation) templates provided for JIRA function different from other applications, such as Confluence.

Example:

*Suggestion*

fields.summary: Change JIRA Data Center AWS quickstart to be similar to other applications

fields.description:
*Summary*

[Getting started with JIRA Data Center on AWS | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/getting-started-with-jira-data-center-on-aws-938846966.html] provides a method for deploying JIRA Data Center into AWS. The documentation can be used to deploy JIRA Data Center but there are some limitations and known issues that an admin should be aware of.

Examples: 
* There are some known issues related to auto-scaling, such as offline node IDs not being removed from the cluster
** JRASERVER-42916 and JRASERVER-65538
* Template does not allow for the selection of version to install/deploy
** JRASERVER-65510 

*Suggestion*

Provide one location that describes known issues and limitations related to JIRA Data Center AWS Quickstart (CloudFormation) templates. 
* Include details related to reporting new issues and limitations. 
* Make it clearer that AWS Quickstart templates are recommended to be used only as a POC (proof of concept). We have the following details, however, this should be clearer to avoid unintended consequences with these CloudFormations.

{quote}"[The QuickStart CloudFormation Templates]should be treated as a reference implementation that shows how JIRA Data Center can be used with AWS, and be either used as-is, or serve as an example for creating your own template."{quote}
fields.summary: Document limitations related to deploying JIRA using AWS CloudFormation Templates

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The History tab of an issue does not keep a hyperlink to pages in Confluence where the issue is mentioned:

 !Screen Shot 2018-05-07 at 15.13.27.png|thumbnail! 

If you check the Activity tab, the hyperlink is present:

 !Screen Shot 2018-05-07 at 15.13.41.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

The History tab should have the same behavior as the Activity tab, where the page is listed as a link.

h3. Why this is important

If you remove the issue from Confluence, it no longer appears in the Activity tab, so we lose the reference to it.

It is still present in the History tab, but it is not possible to identify which page was related due to the lack of hyperlink. If someone accidentally unlinks a Confluence page, users may want to know how they can find the right page from the JIRA history to recreate the link.
fields.summary: History tab does not keep hyperlink to Confluence pages

fields.description:
h2. Description

There's a large javascript error report displayed to a user, related to a QuotaExceededError. This usually happens after opening a board.
h2. Steps to reproduce

The bug occurs when usage data collection mechanism ([details|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0713/data-collection-policy-964984084.html]) exceeds browser's local storage quota. Reproducing it through regular Jira usage is time-consuming and non-deterministic. Instead, one may try triggering it through storing a preposterously large text (the actual limit depends on a browser) to local storage via a developer console.
h2. Expected behaviour

Data collection mechanism exceeding browser's local storage quota does not disrupt user's actions.
h2. Actual behaviour

An error pops up.
h2. Details

Local storage quota varies depending on a browser and its version and is calculated per origin (protocol, hostname and port number). The actual sizes can be found directly via browser or in its documentation.
{code:java}
Exception: Uncaught QuotaExceededError: Failed to execute 'setItem' on 'Storage': Setting the value of 'atlassian-analytics.jira.lock' exceeded the quota.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Internet Explorer (IE) 11 throws "Exception: Object doesn't support this action" for any Agile board:

http://<JIRA_URL>/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=<board_id>
h3. Steps to reproduce

In Internet Explorer 11 login into Jira Sofware (7.6.5):
 * go to the top menu, open Board -> select any board name

h3. Expected Results

A board view without any error or exception.
h3. Actual Results

A selected board view doesn't appear, a user is getting error banner "An error occurred" with JavaScript stack trace information under "Details...". See the screenshot below:

!image-2018-05-03-14-44-07-558.png|width=523,height=247!

IE debugger:

  !image-2018-05-03-13-54-34-074.png|width=526,height=54!

Problematic source code (JavaScript):
{code:java}
var matchIPv6 = new URL(uri).hostname.match(IPv6Regexp);{code}
h3. Workaround

Do not use Internet Explorer 11.
h3. Affected

Jira Software:
 * Platforms: Linux/Windows
 * Versions

 * 
 ** *Affects 7.6.5, 7.7.3, 7.8.3 and 7.9.1*
 ** *issue confirmed on 7.9.1 version (latest)*
 ** < 7.6.5 versions are not affected (verified: 7.6.4, 7.2.12)

Internet Explorer:
 * Versions
 ** 11

h3. Notes

It looks like a known IE issue with missing constructor in URL() class, in Jira Software used in:
 * AJS.parseUri method,
 * jira-greenhopper-plugin-7.6.0 plugin

Similar vendor issue for Edge:

[https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/3775534/]

A quick overview, the following JavaScript code:
{code:javascript}
new URL('http://example.com/');
{code}
in Internet Explorer 11: returns an error "Object doesn't support this action"
 in Chrome: JS object is created (method supported)
fields.summary: "Exception: Object doesn't support this action" in Internet Explorer 11

h3. Summary
Jira 7.9 protocol variable in Commented out SSH settings in the Server.xml changed to *protocol="HTTP/1.1"* from the previously configured *protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol"*

This Requires manualy changing the variable back to protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol" per the [Running JIRA applications over SSL or HTTPS | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-938847764.html] documentation  


h3. Environment
* Jira 7.9.0 and later

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira
# Look at server.xml

h3. Expected Results
The Protocol under commented out SSH variable is set to
*protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol"*

h3. Actual Results
The Protocol under commented out SSH variable is set to
*protocol="HTTP/1.1"*
 
h3. Notes
Relates to changes applied for:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62745
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64082
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63734

h3.Workaround
Manually add the value per [Running JIRA applications over SSL or HTTPS | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-938847764.html] documentation
fields.summary: server.xml protocol variable changed in 7.9

fields.description:
We use Jira for various compliance related needs, and we've found Jira to be a very powerful tool with its custom issue types, custom fields, and custom a workflows that use custom statuses.

As a Jira admin, I'd like to repeat our customizations to another Jira instance with a script, but at the moment, the Jira REST API doesn't seem to cover what we need.

Please extend the Jira REST API so that it can be used for automating such customizations:
 * A REST API for creating a new status (or ensuring that a status with a certain name exists)
 * A REST API for importing a workflow
 * A REST API for creating a field configuration
 * A REST API for creating a screen
fields.summary: Jira REST API enhancements for customizing Jira

Hello,

When creating a commentary via IncomingMail, the persons or roles entered in the Notification Scheme for the event "Issue Commented" receive no notification.

!Incoming-Mail.JPG|width=711,height=408!

!Notification-Scheme.JPG|width=781,height=330!

 

The comments that are created via mail seem to be added as an attachment. -> The notification thus only accesses the event "Issued Updated".

See comments -> Tab Activity:

!image-2018-04-24-08-20-25-073.png|width=823,height=501!
 The notification should also be received by the persons who are registered at the event "Issue Commented".

In addition, the notification at the event "Issue Commented" does not apply even if a comment is added during a workflow step. Behavior is ugly :(

Can you fix the error please?
 We can not set the notification to the Issue Updated event because otherwise the users would receive a notification for every minor change.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing an XML export from Jira Cloud instance to Jira Server instance (such as a Cloud to Server migration), if the XML file was "Exported for Cloud" a non-descriptive error appears during import into Jira Server, and the import fails.

h3. Environment

Two instances:
* Jira Cloud (instance you will backup/export from)
* Instance with newest version of Jira Server (instance you will restore/import into)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
From a Jira Cloud instance, follow the steps within: [Exporting issues - How to create a backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/exporting-issues-776636787.html#Exportingissues-Howtocreateabackup] to create an XML export, to be imported into a Jira Server instance

# Choose the Jira icon > Settings > System
# In the Import and Export section, click Backup manager.
# Select the type of backup:
- Select _Create backup for cloud_
 After the backup is complete, click the file link to download the backup.

On the Jira Server instance, there are two possible scenarios to restore/import the Cloud XML file:

*Scenario 1:* follow the steps within [Import your data from Jira Cloud into Jira Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-938846963.html#MigratingfromJIRACloudtoServerapplications-4.ImportyourdatafromJIRACloudintoJIRAServer]:

In step 2 of the setup wizard (Application Properties), you'll be asked whether you have existing data. Click Import your existing data, and follow instructions to import your XML backup.

*Scenario 2:* follow the steps within [Restoring https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/restoring-data-from-an-xml-backup-938847707.html]

h3. Expected Results

Jira Importer will return an error stating that the XML file had been generated as an export for Jira Cloud, not an export for Jira Server.

h3. Actual Results
The below non-descriptive error is displayed, and XML import fails:
{noformat}
Error: Error importing data: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericEntity.setString] "textvalue" is not a field of
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
KB Documentation [Import your data from Jira Cloud into Jira Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-938846963.html#MigratingfromJIRACloudtoServerapplications-4.ImportyourdatafromJIRACloudintoJIRAServer], does not distinguish between "Exported for Cloud" and "Exported for Server" XML files. However, the user must manually view the XML and find the following entry:

{code}___ Exported for ___________________________

 for                                           : cloud{code}

h3.Workaround
From the Jira Cloud instance, follow the steps within: [Exporting issues - How to create a backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/exporting-issues-776636787.html#Exportingissues-Howtocreateabackup]

# Choose the Jira icon > Settings > System
# In the Import and Export section, click Backup manager.
# Select the type of backup:
- Select _Create backup for Server_
 After the backup is complete, click the file link to download the backup.

Once the above XML file is generated, you can double-check the file, opening it with a text editor, and find the following line: 

 {code}___ Exported for ___________________________

 for                                           : server{code}
fields.summary: Attempting to import a Jira Cloud export into Jira Server results in a non-descriptive error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When I created invitations for my team a number of people incorrectly interpreted the 'user name' field as 'password' so are now proudly referred to as some random combination of letters and numbers.  I wanted to change the full name for them but was unable to change anything except the log-in name and then only when they have logged in.  I signed on as the user themselves still no dice.   I then tried in collaboration with the user to delete their account and recreate it totally from scratch and what should be displayed as the user name but the same password combination as before. So I tried again to delete the account and pressed F5 to ensure the name had left the list of users and added him again - unfortunately this password as a user name will undoubtedly follow him forever unless I can intervene. 

I don't really understand why the user management screen changed when Jira updated - all the functions I could use to actually help users set a password or change their user name have been blocked - this is not a step forward in my opinion as the users in my experience range in IT competence from novice to expert - the novices look to IT for assistance and when I can't help them become frustrated with the software as a whole.
fields.summary: Deleting a User then Recreating them Does Not Wipe User Name

fields.description:
h3. *When updating commit messages from FishEye, JIRA sometimes displays commits it should not, does not display commits it should, and/or displays an inaccurate commit count.*

h3. *Environment*

JIRA Software Server 7.6.1
FishEye 4.5.2
Subversion repository (Tortoise SVN used in these examples)

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

*Scenario 1: I accidentally included the wrong issue key in my commit message*
# Have a JIRA project with two issues: MYPROJECT-1 and MYPROJECT-2. Neither of these issues has any commits associated with them.
# Make a SVN commit with MYPROJECT-1 in the commit message, and wait for the commit to display in JIRA on the issue dev panel as expected.
# *Change the commit message* in SVN. Remove MYPROJECT-1 and insert MYPROJECT-2.
# Reindex the revision properties of that rev in FishEye.

_EXPECTED:_ 
* The dev panel no longer appears on MYPROJECT-1
* The dev panel and this commit appears on MYPROJECT-2

_ACTUAL:_
* The dev panel still appears on MYPROJECT-1 and shows "1 commit." Clicking this link throws an error: 
_"You don't have access to view all related commits. Please contact your administrator."_
* MYPROJECT-2 displays 1 commit and it is this commit. As expected, clicking on the link brings up the commit and it can be viewed.

*Scenario 2: "Oops! I did it again." Now the commit count is wrong.*
# Make a new SVN commit with a message linking to MYPROJECT-1.
# *Observe and note:* MYPROJECT-1's dev panel no longer displays the error message described above, and it now displays the commit that was just sent.
# *Change the commit message* in SVN to point to MYPROJECT-2.
# Reindex the revprops of that revision in FishEye.

_EXPECTED:_ 
* MYPROJECT-1 no longer has a dev panel because it has no commits
* MYPROJECT-2 displays two commits, and the dev panel says "2 commits" at the head

_ACTUAL:_
* MYPROJECT-1 has a link in the dev panel which reads "1 commit" and an error is displayed when clicking on it:
_"You don't have access to view all related commits. Please contact your administrator."_
* MYPROJECT-2 displays two commits as expected, but the dev panel header reads "1 commit"

h3. *Workaround*

The fix described in [FE-6953|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-6953] works to address these scenarios as well. Specifically, you can manually delete cached data from the JIRA database. 

{panel}
For example, if you discover that issue ABC-123 is affected (it has 1 commit but DevPanel doesn't show), you may:
 # Run this REST call to confirm it has 1 commit:
{code:java}
<FeCru_BaseURL>/rest/remote-link-aggregation/latest/aggregation?globalId=ABC-123{code}
 # Run this SQL query in Jira db to confirm Jira has an outdated record of it (no commit):
{code:java}
select * from entity_property where json_value like '%ABC-123%';{code}

{code}
For JIRA 7.9+, run this query instead:
{code:java}
select * from AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY where json like '%"ABC-123"%';
{code}

(+) If the above are confirmed, it's safe to delete the db entry for it to be rewritten with up-to-date data:
{code:java}
delete from entity_property where id = <ID from the above SELECT query>;
{code}

For JIRA 7.9+, run this query instead:
{code:java}
delete from AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY where id = <ID from the above SELECT query>;
{code}

{panel}

h3. *Notes*

* These issues do not appear to occur in JIRA 7.8.1.
* FE-6953 was reported as fixed in FishEye 4.5.1, but the issue described here is occurring with FishEye 4.5.2.
fields.summary: Strange behavior in JIRA dev panel when editing FishEye commit messages

fields.description:
*Issue:* 

The following error messages continue to display in Jira logs after disabled HipChat for Jira plugin.
{code:java}
2018-04-09 20:30:44,856 hipchat-client:thread-3 WARN [c.a.p.hipchat.token.DefaultHipChatTokenRefreshService] Token with name [AddonToken(6)] refresh failed with status code [401]. Error message [Authenticated requests only. See https://www.hipchat.com/docs/apiv2/auth for more information.]. Turn on debug mode to see stack trace.
2018-04-09 20:30:44,862 hipchat-client:thread-3 WARN [c.a.p.h.connect.synchronise.ModifyDescriptorSynchronisationActivity] Authenticated requests only. See https://www.hipchat.com/docs/apiv2/auth for more information.
com.atlassian.hipchat.api.ErrorResponseException: Authenticated requests only. See https://www.hipchat.com/docs/apiv2/auth for more information.
at com.atlassian.hipchat.api.ResourceError$1.apply(ResourceError.java:74)
at com.atlassian.hipchat.api.ResourceError$1.apply(ResourceError.java:71)
at com.atlassian.fugue.Option.map(Option.java:272) {code}
*Step to reproduce:* 

Unable to replicate as hipchat.com is currently being redirected to stride.com.

*Investigation:* 

Hipchat.com was installed for Jira Data Center and hipchat integration was removed at some point from the integration page.

If HipChat integration plugin is disable to avoid the API error message, it will slow down the application restart process as mentioned in below KB, 
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disable-hipchat-integration-plugin-slows-down-application-restart-941590920.html]

*Workaround:* 

Make sure HipChat integration is disabled under "Administration"-> "Applications" ->"hipchat".

If still receiving the API error message, delete everything under the following table will stop all API messages. 
{code:java}
AO_5FB9D7_AOHIP_CHAT_LINK
AO_5FB9D7_AOHIP_CHAT_USER
AO_587B34_PROJECT_CONFIG
AO_587B34_GLANCE_CONFIG{code}
fields.summary: Hipchat API request messages are not stopped after removing hipchat integration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Related to JSWSERVER-15051 and JRASERVER-65602 
JIRA will have memory pressure (and may hit OOME) in case user creates board with filter with large number of issues (20k+). This might lead to performance problems at busy instance. 
While ticket JRASERVER-65602 focuses on empty filter to prevent simple mistakes, it's possible to create filter with large result set. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a new application variable _BOARD_ISSUES_COUNT_LIMIT_ (suggested default value 5000), similar to  jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count in jira-config.properties

While opening any board or changing board filter, check the issues count return by board filter and compare it with BOARD_ISSUES_COUNT_LIMIT.
* Display board only when it has less issues than limit.
* Display warning message if condition fails and redirect users to contact Jira admins.
** see also related JRASERVER-66791

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: As an JIRA Software Administrator I want to limit number of issues per board to prevent resource overuse

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I would like to officially request support for running Jira Software Data Center version specifically, in Docker containers. There are some community versions of docker containers available, or we can build our own containers (though an official dockerfile provided by Atlassian would obviously be welcome), but we will have no official support from Atlassian in the event of something going wrong (unless I am missing something?).

So, this request isn't really for providing docker container versions of major versions of Jira, but rather the support of running this as an enterprise option.

Of course, in a world where upgrading is supposed to happen faster and faster, and become more and more automated, having the ability to make the upgrade process easier, and enabled as part of an automation pipeline, would obviously be incredibly useful.
fields.summary: Official support for running Jira data center in Docker containers

fields.description:
Project admins are able to add users and groups to specific roles.

At times, we may want to restrict this ability. For example all users are part of the "jira-users" group, which grants login access. A project admin, may add this group to certain roles, essentially granting the whole instance access.

In this case, it would be useful if we can mark "jira-users" as a group that should be restricted from project admins.
fields.summary: Ability to Restrict Groups from Project Roles

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a custom Field To a Card as covered in [Customizing cards | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/customizing-cards-938845307.html], valid Custom Field options can be excluded if using an Issue Type in the filter

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Custom Field with *applicable issue types* set to any restricted value (EXE set this to Story only)
# Create a board with a Filter that has an OR statement including *issuetype = <any other issue type>* EXE:
{code}
project = <Insert Project> AND (component = <Insert Component> OR issuetype = <Insert Any Issuetype other than Story>) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
# Navigate to the Boards *Card Layout* and attempt to add in your custom Field

h3. Expected Results
Custom Field is available

h3. Actual Results
Custom Field is missing from potions
 
h3. Notes
The Custom Field should be available as it applies to some but not all of the issues present in the filter results.

h3.Workaround
* Temporarily set the *applicable issue types* under the Custom fields  *scheme context* to *Any Issue Type* see [Specifying field behavior: Modifying field behavior | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/specifying-field-behavior-938847255.html#Specifyingfieldbehavior-changingfieldsModifyingfieldbehavior]
* [Apply desired card layout | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/customizing-cards-938845307.html]
* Reset *applicable issue types* on field configurations back to the desired settings

Once you have the Field added to the card layout you can remove it from the field context to return the setting to the original state and the field will remain will remain on the card without issue.
fields.summary: Card Layout Excludes valid custom fields when board Filter contains Issue Type

h3. Summary

If a dashboard has multiple Agile Wallboard Gadgets, then collapsing one swimlanes, will collapse for all gadgets.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two Agile Wallboard Gadgets on two different dashboards
# For each gadget, choose two different agile boards
# Configure each board to use different types of swimlanes Eg: Assignee, Story
# Go to the dashboard, minimize the one of the swimlanes. Eg: The first swimlane. 
# Reload the other dashboard

h3. Expected Results

The gadget should be in the original expanded form. 

h3. Actual Results

The Agile gadget is minimized exactly as the other gadget. Eg: First swimlane. 
 
h3. Notes

* This occurs if this is also in the same dashboard or if the Agile Wallboard Gadgets are in different dashboards . 
* This occurs if all the gadgets are based on the same board or different boards
* This occurs if the swimlanes are of the same type or different type
fields.summary: If a dashboard has multiple Agile Wallboard Gadgets, then collapsing one swimlanes, will collapse for all

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
Currently, if JIRA is set in English and customer locale language is German, if we want to display JIRA content in german we need to set it manually via user profile page.

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Implement a mechanism JIRA to automatically detects the local language of the user when they are accessing via browser and change language settings in the user profile to match the local language.

h3. *Why this is important*
It would be more comfortable, that the browser automatically detects the language by the locale and changes automatically instead of the user setting the language in their profile. For users who have no experience in these tools is more comfortable.
fields.summary: Change JIRA Language Automatically based on Default Locale Language

fields.description:
We have a release regression that consists of multiple builds(Test Runs). Say Build 1- 5.

For each build we execute a test run that is consists on many test cases.

The same test case can me added to some or all test runs.

It would be good to have a report (TestLink has it) where I would see the cumulative state of all test cases.

The rules are:
 # Say the same test case has been run in 5 Test Runs (passes, failed, passed, failed, not run). The result in the report should say - Failed (status of the last time it has been run)
 # if (failed, not run, not run, not run, not run) the result is failed.
 # if (blocked, not run, not run, not run, not run) the result is blocked
 # if (blocked, failed, not run, passed, not run) - the result is passed
 # etc.

It is very convenient report as it shows all cumulatively failed test cases.

It would also be convenient to have a separate report  where all the test cases (on the left) will have all builds (the header of the table) with the results in the table.

If you already have this report please refer me to it. 

Thanks and appreciate you looking at this.
fields.summary: Multi Test Run cumulative test results report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
CSV Importer will not map fields correctly if there is a custom field named the same as a Jira field.

h4. Environment
Jira 7.6.4

h4. Steps to Reproduce 

1. Create a custom field named "Priority" to be the same name as Jira Field "Priorty"
2. Create a CSV file with the following:

||Issue Type||Issue Key||Issue ID||Summary||Priority||
|Bug| | |This is a test|Medium|

3. Click on Issues -> Import Issues From CSV
4. Click Browse and locate the CSV file created in Step 2
5. Click Next
6. Select the project that has the newly created custom field from Step 1
7. Click Next
8. Select for the "Priority" field to map to the *Jira Issue* "Priority" field and click the Check box to map the value
9. Select to map the "Summary" to "Summary" as required
10. Click Next
11. On the Map Values screen you will see the mappings for the two columns.

h4. Expected Results

* The "Priority" field shows that it will be *imported as Priority*

h4. Actual Results

* The "Priority" field shows that it will *imported as Custom Field Priority*

!Screen Shot 2018-04-05 at 11.55.45 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Workaround

1. Click Back
2. Repeat steps 8 & 9
3. Then you will see it map correctly
fields.summary: CSV Importer will not map fields correctly if there is a custom field named the same as a Jira field

fields.description:
h5. BACKGROUND

Currently, when you perform a large bulk operation and attempt to perform a second bulk operation while the first one is still running, instead of receiving a message indicating that a bulk operation is already running you are instead dropped directly in the progress of the previous operation. This can be disorienting since there is no clear indication that the progress is not for the new operation but the original one.

h5. SUGGESTION

h6. MVP
 * Display a screen that indicates to the user that a bulk operation is already being performed and allow them to click a button to view the progress on that operation.

h6. Nice to Have
 * Allow the user to queue the second bulk operation to begin once the initial operation has completed.
fields.summary: Show message on multiple simultaneous bulk operations

fields.description:
h3. Summary

'Update Parent Issue' message when certain subtasks from the Parent Issue is resolved in a board where other sub tasks of that parent issue doesn't exist

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two boards, one having an extra criteria of a specific label
Board 1: project = ABC ORDER BY Rank ASC
Board 2: project = ABC AND labels = "new" ORDER BY Rank ASC
# Create an issue in the Project and have two subtasks under it
# Give one of the sub-tasks label "new". This should result in this sub tasks showing up in board 2. 
# Move this subtask with label "new" to the last column in *board 2*. 

h3. Expected Results

No popup, as there are sub tasks for the parent issue that have not been completed yet. 

h3. Actual Results

Popup message mentioning that all issues in the parent task is done and it asks if the parent issue should be updated to match this. 
 
h3. Notes
* If *yes* is clicked, the parent is updated to done status/last column and the message keeps looping. 
* The message does not repeat/loop if *cancel* is clicked.
fields.summary: 'Update Parent Issue' message when certain subtasks from the Parent Issue is resolved in a board where other sub tasks of that parent issue doesn't exist

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

First reindex after creating an alternative ranking field takes a lot of time because it needs to perform initial ranking for all the issues.
It may also fail for some of the issues due concurrency reasons while performing foreground reindex.

h3. Suggested Solution

Perform initial ranking immediately after custom field is created.
User will still need to perform full reindex to make use of a new custom field, but at least it won't take extra time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Presently, the version search field (plugins/servlet/project-config/XX/administer-versions) does not strip non-printable characters from inputted text when performing matching. Here's a specific scenario in which this can cause an issue:

* Automation is in place to create versions in Jira project to match the version name of Jenkins builds (automation strips any non-printable characters when creating the version name in Jira)
* When version names become long, Jenkins inserts a 0-width space into the version name
* Users copy-and-paste build names from Jenkins to search for them in Jira
* The copied value includes the 0-width space (<200b>)
* Jira will not find a match as it's including the 0-width space when finding a match

h3. Suggested Solution

Sanitize input on the version search field to remove any non-printable characters from the match string.

h4. Reproduction

Attached is a file containing a version name with a 0-width character. To test, create a version in a Software project called *testversion*. To reproduce, copy and paste the value from the file.
fields.summary: Exclude non-printable characters when matching input from version search field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The “Custom Fields” screen shows all of the projects that a custom field is configured for, so long as it is limited to a subset of projects.

However, if one of the contexts is global and another is limited, the custom field list will only show the limited subset of projects. This gives users the impression that the field is only configured for the limited context and not the global context.

h3. Environment
JIRA Software 7.8.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a New Custom Field of type single-select, have it apply to all
   projects and all issue types. Add three options: red, green, yellow
# Create a second configuration scheme for one or a few projects,
   change available options to blue, violet
# Go back to the Custom Fields screen and scroll to the new field

h3. Expected Results
Field is shown to be configured for all projects (possibly with a text: “see configuration for details”)

h3. Actual Results
Field is shown to be configured only for the project(s) selected for the alternate configuration scheme

h3. Workaround
Go to the global context and individually select all projects rather than using the *Global context* radio button.
fields.summary: "Custom Fields" list doesn't show all projects when a context is also global

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In some rare cases, getting of lexorank row through DB may take more than 4 seconds.


h3. Environment
* Any plugin to create on subtasks on transition
* Some other long-running transition postfunction


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform long-running transition
# Simultaneously try to create issue.

h3. Expected Results
{{rankInitially}} fails with 4sec timeout


h3. Actual Results
{{rankInitially}} waits for transition to finish.
 
h3. Explanation
{{LexorankDao#acquireLock}} is supposed to finish to either succeed or fail immediately. And then there's a lot of error handling about this.
But in case in some other transaction holds an SQL update lock, {{acquireLock}} query will wait for that transition to finish.

h3. Proposed solution
The best way would be to use {{SELECT FOR UPDATE NOWAIT}}. It will properly represent {{tryLock}} nature of {{acquireLock}}. Unfortunately, it is not supported by mysql. (https://dev.mysql.com/worklog/task/?id=3597)
A bit worse option: use {{Statement#setQueryTimeout(int)}} from JDBC. It won't exit immideately, but at least it will fail after some time instead of waiting infinitely.
We are going with the second option

h3.Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Getting DB lock for lexorank may take more than 4 seconds

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description 
For some reasons, under column mapping in the board configuration, if the following situation is being occurred:
* Partial or some status are not being mapped into the correct status column

The only indication provided is under the Board configuration > General, which there is a small warning message. There is no clear error/warning to show indication on the agile board saying:
* some issues are missing in the agile board
* why are those issues are not appearing in the agile board.

This could caused a slight miss if the user is not aware of it and did not carefully count in if all the issues is supposed to be there in the agile board.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Provide a clearer and specific message when some issues are not showing in the agile board and also indicating what is the cause of these issues not showing in the agile board so that it will provide guidance to the board administrator or scrum master to correct this behaviour.
fields.summary: Provide clear message when certain issues is missing in the board
